comments.content:
Perhaps because the second \_i\_ is twisted by a fold in the fabric of the material on which it is printed.  
Similar to various sports and retro scripts, including American Pop [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/american-pop/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/american-pop/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/american-pop/") Home Run Script

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HomeRunScriptAsOriginals_5913.gif)
  [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/doyald-young/home-run/")  
Don

Have not found an exact match.  
A little closer: Pivo

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PivoAsOriginals_6491.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/pivo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/pivo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/pivo/")  
In the ballpark: Number Five Smooth  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NumberFiveSmoothAsOriginals_5034.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/number-five/")  
Don

Also in the ballpark: Monotype Script

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/MonotypeScriptAsOriginals_5952.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/script-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/script-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/script-mt/")  
Don

I just noticed the bottom half of the Adidas logo in the image. Here is a full view of an Adidas product with this script.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418161932im_/http:/typophile.com/files/AdidasOriginalsTShirt_5947.jpg)
  
Based on past experience with clothing companies, I believe that this is likely bespoke lettering.  
Don
